predicate.note: Frames file for 'distinguish' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 23.1, Framenet entry Differentiation.

roleset.name: separate, divide

role.descr: source, separated from, if separate from arg1

example.name: all args
example.text: Soon the studio is producing a $40 million picture called ``Tet, the Motion Picture,'' *trace* to distinguish it from ``Tet, the Offensive,'' as well as ``Tet, the Book'' and ``Tet, the Album.''
example.arg: ``Tet, the Offensive,'' as well as ``Tet, the Book'' and ``Tet, the Album

example.name: just transitive, singular arg1
example.text: In the classroom, students say, Mrs. Yeargin distinguished herself by varying teaching approaches -- forcing kids to pair up to complete classroom work or using college-bowl type competitions.
example.arg: by varying teaching approaches -- forcing kids to pair up to complete classroom work or using college-bowl type competitions

example.name: just transitive, plural arg1
example.text: He distinguished the two cases: In Salinger, Judge Leval noted, the quotations were for the purpose of enlivening the biography rather than of proving points about the subject.

example.name: Bork Bork Bork!
example.text: Unfortunately, Mr. Bork failed *trace* to distinguish between such pressures and the emergence of great issues critical to a society that must be settled judicially if it is to cohere.
example.arg: such pressures and the emergence of great issues critical to a society that must be settled judicially if it is to cohere

roleset.note: When arg1 is singular, there's a default arg2 along the lines of "from his/her/its peers". When arg2 is plural and potentially introduced by a preposition like "between" or "among" the figure (arg1) and ground (arg2) have been merged.
